column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures

Savealife, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have never been on such a life altering drug and I do not mean this in a good way!Had not my epilologist recognized the effects this drug had on my and my husband; I do not think that I would be here to write this. Apparently, keppra causes these side-effects in 20% of those who take it!  Please be aware of the awful side effects!

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had keppra ever since 2009 and it has helped me. The one thing is bad is that I have to take keppra twice a day, one in the morning and one in the evening. I just hope to get off the med one day.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Kelsey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had Epilepsy for 5+ years now. I have been on Keppra for a while at a wide range of strength/dosage(small to large amounts). It has been quite helpful. It was first added as an additional drug - I have had 3 other drugs. It decreased and sometimes prevented the seizures. At one time, for about 1.5 years I only had to take Keppra at a low strength and didnt have a single seizure. However My seizures came back recently due to extremely high stress for a an extended period of time (Stress= #1 cause of seizures occuring). As of now, I am on a high strength of genetric Keppra (4000mg daily) with an additional Rx. The most notable side effect  of Keppra is that my emotions are sometimes applified in certain situations: anger/frustation/anxiety. I have had applified happiness too, but not frequently. Overall I think its fairly effective.

column2: doubt, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Drug caused side effects eight months after treatment for brain trauma. Patient began to talk to himself. healthcare provider never followed up with post-op with Neurologist; patient's condition worsened; been diagnosed with psychosis. never had a mental condition or any other type of disability before the trauma to the brain due to motor vehicle accident.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: CoralinaShell, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was very excited when I started taking Keppra because it meant no more blood tests after years of getting tested at least once a year while on Tegretol. Unfortunately, that was the ONLY good thing about it as Keppra actually made me have seizures at least twice a week and Tegretol let me go almost a month without any. Explain this if you can: Keppra INCREASED the number of seizure triggers to include  some startling noises (such as the phone ringing). As if that was not bad enough, I got the side effect I had been warned about - severe anxiety and irritability - and was lucky to not get fired from my job. What a shame because it did have the two benefits I do not get from Tegretol, no blood tests and no interaction with my birth control pills. Now I am back on Tegretol because the Keppra did more harm than good the whole time I took it and much better both physically and mentally.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Daryl, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I used to have multiple seizures a month. The addition of Keppra has decreased the frequency to a few times a year.

column9: MY FOUR YR OLD DAUGHTER HAS TAKEN KEPPRA FOR THE LAST 10 MONTHS AND THE ONLY SIDE EFFECT I HAVE SEEN IS SEVER MOOD SWINGS.

column9: I really can not comment to much on this drug, but what i do know is that my son had a seizure in april of 07 and one in dec. of 07. He was given htis drug the second go-round. I have noticed that he seems to not remember alot and for the very first time he did not obey staff at his school and kind of being "snippy" towards me, this is not like my "A" student. What is going on.
